item.title: Stop Child Abuse in Residential Programs for Teens Act of 2008

latestAction.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with ten minutes of debate on the Bachmann motion to recommit with instructions. The instructions contained in the motion seek to add an amendment requiring parents or legal guardians to give consent before prescription medication is administered to children. During the course of debate, further proceedings on H.R. 5876 were postponed until a time to be announced.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 223 - 185 (Roll no. 436). (text: CR H5734-5735)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 223 - 185 (Roll no. 436).(text: CR H5734-5735)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 220 - 179 (Roll no. 435). (consideration: CR H5738-5739, H5742; text: CR H5738-5739)
Considered as unfinished business. (consideration: CR H5742-5743)

POSTPONED PROCEEINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 1276, the Chair put the question of ordering the previous question on H.Res. 1276 and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Lincoln Diaz-Dalart demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of ordering the previous question on H.Res. 1276 until later in the legislative day.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1276.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H5734-5739)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 236.

The rule waives all points of order against consideration of the bill except clauses 9 and 10 of rule XXI. The amendment in the nature of a substitute recommended by the Committee on Education and Labor now printed in the bill shall be considered as an original bill for the purpose of amendment. The rule waives all points of order against the amendment in the nature of a substitute except for clause 10 of rule XXI.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-717, by Mr. Cardoza.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-717, by Mr. Cardoza.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of H.R. 5876 (Stop Child Abuse in Residential Programs for Teens Act of 2008).

bill.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 5876) to require certain standards and enforcement provisions to prevent child abuse and neglect in residential programs, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
